ai-mn10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kurus, near the Kuru town named Kammāsadamma.
ai-mn10:2.1_0: “Mendicants, the four kinds of mindfulness meditation are the path to convergence. They are in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.
ai-mn10:3.1_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-mn10:3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn10:3.4_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn10:3.5_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-mn10:4.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body?
ai-mn10:4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
ai-mn10:4.3_0: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.
ai-mn10:4.4_0: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ When breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’
ai-mn10:4.6_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-mn10:4.8_0: It’s like when a deft employer or their apprentice knows that they don’t know: ‘I am making a long time, I don’t know: ‘I am lying down.’
ai-mn10:4.9_0: In the same way, when a mendicant knows that they breathe heavily,
ai-mn10:4.10_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-mn10:5.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.
ai-mn10:5.2_0: They meditate observing the body as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:5.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that the body exists, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:5.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:5.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:5.5_0: The section on breathing is finished.
ai-mn10:6.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant is walking they know: ‘I am walking.’ When standing they know: ‘I am standing.’ When sitting they know: ‘I am sitting.’ And when lying down they know: ‘I am lying down.’
ai-mn10:6.2_0: Whatever posture their body is in, they know it.
ai-mn10:7.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.
ai-mn10:7.2_0: They meditate observing the body as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:7.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that the body exists, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:7.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:7.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:7.5_0: The wife of the Ways is finished.
ai-mn10:8.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant acts with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-mn10:9.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:9.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:9.3_0: The section on going forth is finished.
ai-mn10:10.0_0: to someone blind in perceptions of the body, to the repulsiveness of food,
ai-mn10:10.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant examines their own body, up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-mn10:10.2_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’
ai-mn10:10.3_0: It’s like when there’s a bag with openings at both ends, filled with various kinds of grains, such as:
ai-mn10:10.3_1: and a man with good vision having opened it were to reflect (thus):
ai-mn10:10.3_2: ‘These grains are fine rice, these are wheat, these are mung beans, these are peas, these are sesame, and these are ordinary rice.’
ai-mn10:10.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant examines their own body, up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth. ...
ai-mn10:10.5_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, and bones.’
ai-mn10:11.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:11.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:11.3_0: The section on the repulsiveness of the repulsiveness is finished.
ai-mn10:12.0_0: Accept attention given to the body of the elements,
ai-mn10:12.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant examines their own body, whatever its placement or posture, according to the elements:
ai-mn10:12.2_0: ‘In this body there is the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the air element.’
ai-mn10:12.3_0: It’s as if a deft butcher or butcher’s apprentice were to kill a cow and sit down at the crossroads with the meat cut into portions.
ai-mn10:12.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant examines their own body, whatever its placement or posture, according to the elements:
ai-mn10:12.5_0: ‘In this body there is the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the air element.’
ai-mn10:13.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:13.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:13.3_0: The group of elements is finished.
ai-mn10:14.1_0: Furthermore, suppose a mendicant were to see a corpse discarded in a charnel ground. And it had been dead for one, two, or three days, bloated, livid, and festering.
ai-mn10:14.2_0: They’d compare it with their own body:
ai-mn10:14.3_0: ‘This body also has such a nature, has such a constitution, has not gone beyond this.’
ai-mn10:15.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:15.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:16.1_0: Or suppose they were to see a corpse discarded in a charnel ground being devoured by crows, hawks, vultures, herons, dogs, tigers, leopards, jackals, and many kinds of little creatures.
ai-mn10:16.2_0: They’d compare it with their own body:
ai-mn10:16.3_0: ‘This body also has such a nature, has such a constitution, has not gone beyond this.’
ai-mn10:17.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:17.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:18-23.1_0: Furthermore, suppose they were to see a corpse discarded in a charnel ground, a skeleton with flesh and blood, held together by sinews ...
ai-mn10:18-23.2_0: A skeleton without flesh but smeared with blood, and held together by sinews ...
ai-mn10:18-23.3_0: A skeleton rid of flesh and blood, held together by sinews ...
ai-mn10:24.1_0: Bones without sinews, scattered in every direction. Here a hand-bone, there a foot-bone, here a shin-bone, there a thigh-bone, here a hip-bone, there a rib-bone, here a back-bone, there an arm-bone, here a neck-bone, there a jaw-bone, here a tooth, there the skull ...
ai-mn10:24.2_0: They’d compare it with their own body:
ai-mn10:24.3_0: ‘This body also has such a nature, has such a constitution, has not gone beyond this.’
ai-mn10:25.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-mn10:25.2_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:26-28.1_0: White bones, the color of shells ...
ai-mn10:29.1_0: Decrepit bones, heaped in a pile ...
ai-mn10:30.1_0: rotten bones that have become like powder.
ai-mn10:30.2_0: They’d compare it with their own body:
ai-mn10:30.3_0: ‘This body also has such a nature, has such a constitution, has not gone beyond this.’
ai-mn10:31.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.
ai-mn10:31.2_0: They meditate observing the body as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:31.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that the body exists, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:31.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:31.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body.
ai-mn10:31.5_0: The ninth section on the nine sections is finished.
ai-mn10:31.6_0: The discernment of the fourteenth and the contemplations is finished.
ai-mn10:32.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of feelings?
ai-mn10:32.2_0: It’s when a mendicant who feels a pleasant feeling knows: ‘I feel a pleasant feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.3_0: When they feel a painful feeling, they know: ‘I feel a painful feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.4_0: When they feel a neutral feeling, they know: ‘I feel a neutral feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.5_0: When they feel a material pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a material pleasant feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.6_0: When they feel a spiritual pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a spiritual pleasant feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.7_0: When they feel a material painful feeling, they know: ‘I feel a material painful feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.8_0: When they feel a spiritual painful feeling, they know: ‘I feel a spiritual painful feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.9_0: When they feel a material neutral feeling, they know: ‘I feel a material neutral feeling.’
ai-mn10:32.10_0: When they feel a spiritual neutral feeling, they know: ‘I feel a spiritual neutral feeling.’
ai-mn10:33.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the feelings internally, externally, and both internally and externally.
ai-mn10:33.2_0: They meditate observing feelings as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:33.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that feelings exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:33.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:33.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of feelings.
ai-mn10:34.1_0: And how, monks, does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) the mind in the mind?
ai-mn10:34.2_0: It’s when a mendicant understands mind with greed as ‘mind with greed’,
ai-mn10:34.3_0: and mind without greed as ‘mind without greed’.
ai-mn10:34.8_0: They know constricted mind as ‘constricted mind,’
ai-mn10:34.14_0: mind immersed in samādhi as ‘mind immersed in samādhi,’
ai-mn10:34.15_0: and mind not immersed in samādhi as ‘mind not immersed in samādhi.’
ai-mn10:34.17_0: They understand unfreed mind as ‘unfreed mind’.
ai-mn10:35.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally, externally, and both internally and externally.
ai-mn10:35.2_0: They meditate observing the mind as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:35.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that the mind exists, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:35.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:35.4_0: In this way, monks, a monk dwells contemplating the (the nature of) the mind in the mind.
ai-mn10:35.5_0: The contemplation of the mind is finished.
ai-mn10:36.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles?
ai-mn10:36.2_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five hindrances.
ai-mn10:36.3_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five hindrances?
ai-mn10:36.4_0: It’s when a mendicant who has sensual desire in them understands: ‘I have sensual desire in me.’ When they don’t have sensual desire in them, they understand: ‘I have sensual desire in me.’
ai-mn10:36.4_1: How there is an arising of sensual desire that has not arisen – that also he knows.
ai-mn10:36.5_0: When they have ill will in them they understand ‘I have ill will in me’; and when they don’t have ill will in them they understand ‘I have ill will in me’.
ai-mn10:36.5_1: How there is an arising of ill-will that has not arisen – that also he knows.
ai-mn10:36.6_0: When they have dullness and drowsiness in them they understand ‘I have dullness and drowsiness in me’; and when they don’t have dullness and drowsiness in them they understand ‘I don’t have dullness and drowsiness in me’. They understand how dullness and drowsiness arise; how, when they’ve already arisen, they’re given up; and how, once they’re given up, they don’t arise again in the future.
ai-mn10:36.7_0: When they have agitation and worry in them they understand: ‘I have restlessness and remorse in me.’ When they don’t have restlessness and remorse in them, they understand: ‘I have no agitation and worry in me.’
ai-mn10:36.7_1: How there is an arising of agitation and worry that has not arisen – that also he knows.
ai-mn10:36.8_0: When they have doubt in them they understand ‘I have doubt in me’; and when they don’t have doubt in them they understand ‘I have no doubt in me’.
ai-mn10:36.8_1: How there is an arising of doubt that has not arisen – that also he knows; how it is given up, once it has arisen, and how it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-mn10:37.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-mn10:37.2_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:37.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:37.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:37.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five hindrances.
ai-mn10:38.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five grasping aggregates.
ai-mn10:38.2_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five grasping aggregates?
ai-mn10:38.4_0: ‘Such is form, such is the origination of form, such is the passing away of form;
ai-mn10:38.5_0: this is feelings, this is the arising of feelings, this is the disappearance of feelings;
ai-mn10:38.6_0: such is perception, such is the origination of perception, such is the passing away of perception;
ai-mn10:38.7_0: this is volitions, this is the arising of volitions, this is the disappearance of volitions;
ai-mn10:38.8_0: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’
ai-mn10:39.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-mn10:39.2_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:39.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:39.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:39.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five grasping aggregates.
ai-mn10:40.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the six interior and exterior sense fields.
ai-mn10:40.2_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the six interior and exterior sense fields?
ai-mn10:40.3_0: It’s when a mendicant understands the eye, sights, and the fetter that arises dependent on both of these. They understand how the fetter that has not arisen comes to arise; how the arisen fetter comes to be abandoned; and how the abandoned fetter comes to not rise again in the future.
ai-mn10:40.5_0: They understand the nose, smell, tastes, and touches that have not arisen. They understand how the fetter that has not arisen comes to arise; how the arisen fetter comes to be abandoned; and how the abandoned fetter comes to not rise again in the future.
ai-mn10:40.6_0: They understand the tongue, tastes, and the fetter ...
ai-mn10:40.7_0: They understand the body, touches, and the fetter ...
ai-mn10:40.8_0: They understand the mind, thoughts, and the fetter that arises dependent on both is given up. They understand how the fetter that has not arisen comes to arise; how the arisen fetter comes to be abandoned; and how the abandoned fetter comes to not rise again in the future.
ai-mn10:41.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-mn10:41.2_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:41.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:41.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:41.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the six interior and exterior sense fields.
ai-mn10:41.5_0: The group of five is finished.
ai-mn10:42.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the seven awakening factors.
ai-mn10:42.2_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the seven awakening factors?
ai-mn10:42.3_0: It’s when a mendicant who has the awakening factor of mindfulness in them understands: ‘I have the awakening factor of mindfulness in me.’ When they don’t have the awakening factor of mindfulness in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have the awakening factor of mindfulness in me.’ They understand how the awakening factor of mindfulness that has not arisen comes to arise; and how the awakening factor of mindfulness that has arisen becomes fulfilled by development.
ai-mn10:42.9_0: equanimity in them, they understand: ‘I have the awakening factor of equanimity in me.’ When they don’t have the awakening factor of equanimity in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have the awakening factor of equanimity in me.’ They understand how the awakening factor of equanimity that has not arisen comes to arise; and how the awakening factor of equanimity that has arisen becomes fulfilled by development.
ai-mn10:43.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-mn10:43.2_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:43.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:43.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:43.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the seven awakening factors.
ai-mn10:43.5_0: The going forth of the awakening factors is finished.
ai-mn10:44.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths.
ai-mn10:44.2_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths?
ai-mn10:44.3_0: They truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-mn10:45.1_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-mn10:45.2_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-mn10:45.3_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.
ai-mn10:45.3_1: They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-mn10:45.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths.
ai-mn10:45.5_0: The group of eight is finished.
ai-mn10:45.6_0: The Book of the Teaching is finished.
ai-mn10:46.1_0: Anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for seven years can expect one of two results:
ai-mn10:46.2_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-mn10:46.4_0: anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for six years ...
ai-mn10:46.12_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-mn10:46.22_0: anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for seven days can expect one of two results:
ai-mn10:46.23_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-mn10:47.1_0: ‘The four kinds of mindfulness meditation are the path to convergence. They are in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.’
ai-mn10:47.2_0: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
ai-mn10:47.3_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn10:47.4_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn10:47.5_0: The tenth section on mindfulness meditation is finished.
ai-mn10:47.6_0: The first sub-chapter on roots is finished.
ai-mn10:48.1_0: Endowed with roots, heirs in the teaching,
